sections.purpose: To describe the standard operating procedure for the operation of Liquid Filling Machine for accurate and hygienic filling of liquid pharmaceutical products into containers.
sections.scope: Applicable to liquid filling activities carried out in the Pharmaceutics.
procedure: Ensure the machine is installed in a clean area meeting GMP requirements.
Verify all utilities including electricity, compressed air, and water supply are connected.
Check that filling nozzles, product tank, and piping are clean and sanitized.
Power ON the liquid filling machine and initialize control system.
Install appropriate filling nozzles based on container size and fill volume.
Adjust container handling components including guides and grippers.
Fill product tank with prepared liquid formulation.
Prime filling lines by running product through nozzles.
Purge air from lines and verify smooth product flow.
Set fill volume using volumetric or time-based controls.
Adjust conveyor speed and filling cycle parameters.
Place empty containers on infeed conveyor.
Perform trial filling and verify fill volume accuracy.
Adjust filling parameters if volume deviation exceeds limits.
Start production at appropriate speed once accuracy is confirmed.
Monitor filling operation for consistent volume and no spillage.
Check fill volume periodically using graduated cylinder or weighing.
Verify no-bottle-no-fill safety system functionality.
Inspect containers for proper fill level and absence of contamination.
After completion, drain residual product from tank and lines.
Perform cleaning-in-place or manual cleaning as per procedures.
Sanitize all product contact surfaces before next use.
Document fill volumes, parameters, and quality checks in the batch record.
precautions: Maintain aseptic conditions for sterile or preservative-free products.
Ensure containers are clean and free from particulates.
Monitor fill accuracy regularly to maintain dose uniformity.
Check for leaks in filling system before starting.
Use appropriate product-contact materials compatible with formulation.
Wear appropriate PPE including gloves, gown, and hair cover.
Properly dispose of spillage and rejected containers.
